website_summaries.verdict: Tall boots that deliver rain protection top to bottom.
pros: Perfect protection against water all the way to the knee
Reinforced toe and heel for plenty of longevity
Can roll down the top portion of the boots to make them cooler to wear
Keep feet warm even in cold, wet weather
cons: Too many features for those who just want a simple boot

customer_reviews.title: Boots are falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing product, Ive had these just over a year and the boots are literally falling apart. I wear them a couple hours at most each weekend. The rubber is coming loose from the sole. I paid about 100 for these original Muck boots. I wouldnt buy them again and cant recommend them. I did contact Muck about the boots, but 14 months is out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Walton

customer_reviews.title: If wearing for everyday work, dont purchase..
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased so he would have insulated work boots! He thought they were comfortable and they kept his feet warm like he wanted. The reason I gave three stars is because he's only had the boots for over a month and the side of the boots have already started to tear on both boots. If this didnt happen I'd give it 5 stars. So if you wear them for work, I wouldn't recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Ashcraft

customer_reviews.title: Stepped into them fresh out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: and haven't taken them off except to sleep. It's been a wet and wild couple of weeks here in UpCountry Maui, far from the beach! I ordered these to wear while I was working on our little ranch, We've had downed trees, fences to repair, mud and muck to move! Love the support of the hightops, love that they keep my feet dry and warm while I'm walking through the pastures. They are HEAVY, but I'm not doing 12 miles of trail so I don't mind. Good grip on uneven, wet terrain. I've worn them while for every recovery chore including checking on our 3 new calves, all born during a horrendous storm. Hope they last awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Jakesmom

customer_reviews.title: They're light weight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a pair of brown muck boots for some time now. I finally bit the bullet and bought a pair that I absolutely love. They are high but light weight and will be used daily this fall and winter when it is wet and muddy at the barn. I am hopeful they will last much, much longer than the cheaper rubber boots I had been wearing. I would recommend Muck Wetland field boots to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: susiecue

customer_reviews.title: Hurt if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had not purchased these boots. I have wide feet and these things just flat out hurt my feet after wearing them once in the field. Guess I can't return them but I could not have felt this pain just walking around the living room. The boots are well-made for what they are, but they flat out hurt my feet and feel very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R.

customer_reviews.title: Order one  full size bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. However if you have a high instep and or fat foot order one size larger than you think. I typically wear a 9-9 1/2 EEE originally ordered a 10. Arch to instep was to narrow and caused severe foot pain. I wore them an extended time hoping they would loosen up. Nope! Re ordered an 11. I had the same boot in a 10 from 6 years ago that fit perfect however something changed in there design/mold. With warm socks it now fits great. Nice and warm, flexible and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S

customer_reviews.title: Torn on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my brother. He wore them hunting and they tore on the first time out. I called Muck and they recommended Chore Cool Tall as a similar breathable replacement but more durable upper. Other brother has the Pursuit Glory boot but they are basically a rubber boot with a loose ankle. He hates them because the ankle is sloppy and are terrible to walk in. The Wetland and Edgewater are very comfortable however the Edgewater tread is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Innis

customer_reviews.title: Big name,low quality control
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive these boots as I had just returned a pair of a different brand that fit too large. Upon opening the box I was immediately disappointed with the finish quality of the product. The seam where the lower rubber met the neoprene was knicked up and you could see where the lower had been poorly cut to the pattern and small cut marks were in the neoprene. Not okay for what I'm paying. I expected a higher quality product. I know they will get trashed from use, but I am paying for a new item. Back in the box they go and off to the delivery carrier.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: waste materials can't stop these Mucks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Wetland Muck Boots. I am very tough on my boots. I clean with high pressure water for about four hours everyday. They are strong and hold up to the constant abuse i give them. my feet stay warm and dry even in single digit weather to 19 below. Mud, rocks, steel bars, waste materials can't stop these Mucks! Get yours now!
customer_reviews.author: Les Geurin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable, lightweight boot. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They are comfortable, durable, and not too hot. I stabbed them with a wire the second time I wore them and was terrified I put a hole in them. However, it did not penetrate through and they are still waterproof. I've put them through a lot in the few months I've had them, including flooding them with water, and they still work great. And, they fold down.
customer_reviews.author: cheloniophile

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The last 2 pairs of these that I have owned have not held up very well. The insoles are junk and the boot portion separates from the upper portion . Will not buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my current Muck boots with these which are the same as my old ones. The old ones lasted 10 years and still are fine but developed a pin hole in the back of one boot. Even this is not a problem until you wade into a pond and your one heel gets wet. They are warm in the winter and I have worn them while shoveling snow. These boots are on the expensive side but well worth the money. The tread on the soles is aggressive and provides good traction in snow and mud. I find them comfortable and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this brand.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend Muck boots. THey use to be a good brand. Wore these for a week of hunting and got 2 holes in them They were to have a year warranty. THey were only 3 months old. THe company said they were not covered under the warranty. I just spent 130.00 for 1 week of hunting. I will choose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time owner of Muck Boots. I live in NH-so a good pair of boots is crucial. After many postive reviews from friends, I decided to purchase a pair of boots off Amazon. A little over a year of owning them, they are beginning to come apart on both left and right boots. I do not do anything extreme with them, so I am disappointed they can not withstand a few hours of occasional wearing. I will not be recommending Muck Boots to peers. Sincerely, One sad customer
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Best Wetland Boots I Own
customer_reviews.text: I take these out in a variety of wetland, of varying difficulty to walk. They are pretty great. I have small calves and even smaller feet (size 5 in women) and these fit perfectly. PLUS the top part has an elastic band, so it fits snug around my leg, providing even better protection. But co-worker, who has a size 8 and larger calves, has no issue. She loves them as well. It should be noted, these have great grip when walking in the mud or on dirt, but are slippery on wood and slick concrete. But that's not really what they are made for.
customer_reviews.author: Zeima

customer_reviews.title: World's most awesome boot
customer_reviews.text: I have had many pairs of so called water boots or hunting boots over the years. These are by far the best I have ever put my feet into. First off they went on like a glove and then came off just as easily. I have never been able to get boots off but these slip on and off like slippers. We will see how they hold up over time but they appear to be top notch quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tod C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I wear 1 size up from my normal boot size. My last pair (Arctic Sport) lasted 9 years of canoe portaging and mud & snow as work boots - they are still going, but the tread is wearing out. Muck boots are waterproof, comfortable and have good traction & support whether carrying packs & canoes over rocky/muddy portages, standing in water, or working burying utilities in muddy trenches, or spring ice fishing - I’ve used the same pair for 9 years - no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: william b lovaas

customer_reviews.title: Me likey!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a pair of Muck boots lasts about 3 years, in my usage. The previous new pair from 2 weeks ago were sized 12, but they were not identical in fit. Amazon took care of sending me a replacement pair, and they are fine. I use the Wetland boots year-round, and recommend them if you need a comfortable, dry slipper-feeling boot.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: love muck boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my teenage son and the artic version for myself. We hunt and ice fish. He ditched his timberlands in favor of these at work for a local grocery store, where he works out in the parking lot. The timberlands required constant silicone maintenance and washing to remove road salt. He just hoses these off at night and throws them in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Dean McD

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry feet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as a gift. They fit as expected. He loves these. He wears them to work (construction) and hunting. They keep his feet dry and warm. Now he wants another pair so he has a pair to work in and a separate pair to hunt in.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Boots of high quality and good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought size 12 (my normal sneaker size). Width & length fit comparably to my sneakers. Boot height is good for wading in shallow sections of the creek they will be used in. Seem to be well constructed. Have tested in rain (no problems) but have not waded in them yet. Overall I'm pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Donald Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Warm enough, good in snow
customer_reviews.text: I tried all the local good boots and they were all either too uncomfortable or too slippery in snow. These are great. Only hard part is getting them off. I ordered a size bigger intentionally since I inherited my mother’s bunions, and with warm socks, they’re perfect. Easy to slide on. Just a bit soft when it comes to taking them off but that is a small trade-off.
customer_reviews.author: kjlonghill

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are so worth the extra cost over cheaper brand boots. They are so much more comfortable and the foot bed keeps you from feeling every little rock. Definitely a must for farms, nurseries, and other outdoor wet environment work. Spend the extra for these boots. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Coury

customer_reviews.title: and he said they fit great. I ordered the women's 8s and wear 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of Mucks, so when my son bought his own first ten acres, he commented he'd be needing boots to clean up the overgrown landscaping. We buy pines every year from www.arborgen.us, so Muck Boots are a godsend for us and all those we recruit to help plant Mud, scorpions, snakes, thorny bushes, NOTHING is an excuse from planting day when their huge bags of trees are delivered! I ordered his regular size 11s, and he said they fit great. I ordered the women's 8s and wear 8 - 8.5 and they fit well too. We wear them year-round and they're very comfortable. Good arch support.
customer_reviews.author: TexasNative

customer_reviews.title: Muck boots have been excellent over past 14 years with quality issues these past 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: The past few years the boots haven't held up as well as in earlier years. I took a chance with this set and hope the quality has improved. They are tight initially but stretch a bit over time to be very comfortable. They provide great support and are excellent field and stream boots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Boot leaks after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because I have worn Muck Boots before. This morning one foot was soaked after I changed irrigation. I don't think 5 months is a good life for a pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Husband approved
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a birthday present and he loves them. He normally wears a size 10 in boots but in these he wears a size 9! Wears them with anything and everywhere. He has another pair that has lasted him for 10 years so far they are just the wrong size! Highly recommend these for an out door guy
customer_reviews.author: Kayyj

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: They were true to side but both boots had something in the back that was putting alot of pressure on my heel. I wore them for a minute in the house and couldnt stand them any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy doe

customer_reviews.title: would ABSOLUTELY buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my son who was in desperate need. Said it was the best gift he has gotten in a long time! They keep his feet warm and dry...yet not too warm to wear now that summer is on it's way. He loves them! Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: scott hoff

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these primarily to work in my shop in the winter, where temps drop below 0 F at times. Even on the concrete floor my feet are kept TOASTY warm. I just wish they had half sizes! Have trounced through shin deep water in these as well - they are completely waterproof. Just great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a great product
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for around the farm. Warm in the cold but not to bad in summer either. My last ones lasted 9 years till a mower caught a boot. These are just like my old ones and I hope they wear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: The wrong size was sent. I returned them. Seemed like a quality product otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in February of 2020. Absolutely love these boots. To be able to roll the tops down allow some fresh air in the boot then roll them back up and continue walking through foot and half water with no problems. Also kept my feet completely warm in cold water
customer_reviews.author: michael watson

customer_reviews.title: Not afraid to run through the water and mud anymore
customer_reviews.text: The boots kept my socks and feet warm and dry. I wear a 8 1/2 shoe and the boots only come in full sizes. I got the size 9 boots, added a Scholl's Work insert and a second pair of socks. I do Search and Rescue in the rain and mud and they have been great. I wish I bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Mateo G. Toribio

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this same boot twice in the same size (fulfilled by amazon both times). The first time it fit great, the second time it appeared to be 3-4 sizes too big. I checked the tag and it is still labeled as a women's size 7. I'm not sure what the issue is but I wouldn't recommend buying muck boots through amazon. The photo compares the second pair of boots (women's size 7) to a standard woman's size 8 sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Julia McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Good boot but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with these are made very well. Stayed waterproof for 24+ rigorous miles carrying packs and boats in the bwca. Only downfall is being rubber/neoprene they are quite warm in 65+ degree temps. My feet smelled horrible each day when I crawled into my tent. I have not found anything better though so I will continue using these for my wet and sloppy trail needs for the foreseeable future. Traction was good to great, comfort was also good. Fit for me was good with the 10 which is the same size I wear with rocky boots or tennis shoes. I did wear thick wool socks for both warmth and moisture wicking.
customer_reviews.author: J.Green

customer_reviews.title: Overall a Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very excited to get these as a Christmas gift. Since he has a hard time getting his feet into boots without laces I was a little concerned with the shaft height, but he slipped into them without a problem. They keep his feet warm and are comfortable. The only thing that he wasn't thrilled with was that there isn't much support in the heel, but that is easily fixed with some inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi L R

customer_reviews.title: Boots have very poor traction and are actually quite poor when going up ....
customer_reviews.text: My old Mucks finally got a hole in them where I needed to replace. These new boots seem well constructed but actually are very slippery over certain surfaces that no other shoe/boot that I have is. Walking up a blacktopped incline...walking over a wood deck that is wet. Quite disappointing on that front. I assumed they would be of the same quality as my previous boots so I threw the box away after they arrived. Otherwise, I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: David H Smith

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for with muck  GREAT BOOT
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable right out of the box. True to size . Toe box is solid for a little protection. Very aggressive tred as well. Feels like a good boot
customer_reviews.author: Rory Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Opened box upon  arrival
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took them out of the opened box they came in and went to pull them on my feet the top trim ring ripped off. It was very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Koser

customer_reviews.title: HUGE boots!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 15 in boots. I wasn’t even gonna write this review but I had to return the 15s for 14s and the 14s are still way too big. Gonna have to return them again and get 13s. Im not sure if it’s normal that they are 2 sizes to big but sure enough the 14s feel like my feet are swimming!! Seem like good boots though. Hopefully it will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I have slaughter couple days a week and they are the best boots I found. I went a size up to have room for wool sucks in the winter. I absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: magdalena

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson was absolutely thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: Our almost-16-year-old grandson is going duck hunting this weekend, and he is SO happy to have a comfortable pair of boots that fit - he wears a size 15! He walked around our house for quite a while, describing how comfortable these boots are and how much he's going to enjoy wearing them on the hunt. I know they'll last a long, long time. He specified the brand of boots, so I know he's asked lots of people for advice about them.
customer_reviews.author: suzyinfearrington

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof Mud Boots
customer_reviews.text: A friend suggested these. The fit seemed fine (13 mens). I usually have to order a "wide" but these are fine. Material seems durable and tread on the sole looks great. I am impressed so far. Hope I can say that in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, warm, keeps my feet dry. So far they're everything a good boot should be, easy to roll the top down which is a plus over normal rubber boots, and good traction. *edit* Over a year later and still love the boots. They're great in winter for snow, summer for everything from fishing to nasty chores you'd like the ability to hose off (although a little warm for me in summer, but that's even the case with steel toe work boots). Hessitated to buy these because of the cost, wich I had bought them earlier.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyVR6

customer_reviews.title: Reliable like a good friend.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They fit well, are comfortable, super versatile. They go with anything, anywhere, do anything: Sun, rain, snow, backyard, farm, hiking, wading, fishing, jobsite, holiday shopping the Magnificent Mile in Chicago in a snowstorm. They're neoprene, so they get hot and don't breath well. So plan accordingly and care for them. They'll carry you, sleeping kids, and priceless packages, anywhere, any time.
customer_reviews.author: co2-klr

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to be very good, but they haven't been put thru the test
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son, who wears a size 13. Had to return for a size 12. Quality seems to be very good, but they haven't been put thru the test, yet. So will update if he has any problems with them. I, personally, think it is a ridiculous price for a pair of mud boots, so your paying for the label!
customer_reviews.author: Lesa J Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: About my 5th pair of muck boots nothing is as comfortable walking, working, hunting, fishing, you nam it. I wear out a pair of these.about every three years because I live in them for most of the year. They are not suitable for hot weather but are great for temps less than 70 degrees. Very water proof and great traction in most environments. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Muck boots are the ones to buy...
customer_reviews.text: All of us wear Muck boots our grandchildren are tough on them riding 4 wheelers getting muddy walking in the woods they last a long time. I wear mine out in the woods because of snakes.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Garrison

customer_reviews.title: China versus Vietnam
customer_reviews.text: My old pair were made in China. This new pair were made in Vietnam. If you are looking for a good comfortable rubber boot this is Definitely for you.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY PAINFUL
customer_reviews.text: It digs into the center if my chin and is rubbing the skin off. I can't wear them. Waaaaay to expensive to not be able to return or exchange
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L. McCallister

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing -Poor Quality, but Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Muck boots are comfortable, but don’t last. I have had three pairs of their wetland boots in two years, and the soles fall apart. I am easy on boots and shoes. I wear them and average of once a week. Reglueing does not help for long. Switching brands.
customer_reviews.author: dreamweaver

customer_reviews.title: Nothing compares to Muck Boots
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these wetland boots. I have wanted a pair of Muck boots for a few years now, after hearing friends talk so highly of them. I finally broke down and bought these before hunting season this year. They are amazing. I have yet to get cold or wet while wearing them. I have been out ice fishing all day when there is 2 inches of water on the ice and my feet stay dry and warm. Great quality boot. They have held up good so far but will check in again about wether they start breaking down. Dont hold your breath though, i have seen them last a long time over heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot for Wetlands
customer_reviews.text: This is really the best boots you can buy for wetland use. The are comfortable and various arch supports can be used with them.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas T.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: They fit decent, very comfortable compared to other rubber boots but that is to be expected with the price. Very comfortable and waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: TCB2Country

customer_reviews.title: Best winter boot I've  tried them all!
customer_reviews.text: Great boot my go to barn boot for years. Warm even below -20. My secound pair in 10 years. Yes the hold up very well. I've had Bogs an they can't hold a candle next to them.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Muck does it again
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't expect a lot of arch support from a rubber field boot and I wouldn't expect to go a long distance in this one. But the build quality and the workmanship of this boot makes it well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M&J

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved the boots and said they were very comfortable. He has had several pairs of muck boots and these are his favorite so far
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Tight in calf!
customer_reviews.text: The shaft of the boot is really snug around the calf. I am a woman with really small calves, only 14" around, so I never expected this problem. I ordered men's 6/women's 7 size. The size fits my foot perfectly, but the calf is SNUG. I would never be able to tuck even light pants into them in the outdoor wetlands and my pants will get muddy and soaked. What's the deal MuckBoots?! Lovely boot otherwise. Could use more flexibility in the front of boot when walking, it knocked into my front shin with every step.
customer_reviews.author: F.Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Will not last
customer_reviews.text: Wore them one day out in the swamp/wetland and the sidewalls on the sole ripped quick, Sole and outter wall should be a lot more durable than this. Not really built for the wetlands.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for all day wear. Seem to be holding up pretty well. I love the fact that they skip on and off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots. Roomy, comfortable and great fit! I wore my last pair out!
customer_reviews.author: Jill M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Right & Left manufactered on different soles
customer_reviews.text: 3rd pair of Mucks. The right and left boot feel like there is a full size difference between them. Toe cap is different, too, although they are both branded as "Wetlands" and marked as the same size, feels like one was manufactured on a different last than the other.
customer_reviews.author: Privacy Please

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the most comfortable boots i have ever used. I have a size 14 foot and these are roomy but stay on the foot.
customer_reviews.author: elliott c perry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot!
customer_reviews.text: Stands up to rough environment well. Warm and stays moisture resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. Potthoff

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Rubber Boots
customer_reviews.text: These fit well, and allow room for an orthotic insole, needed for various foot problems. They come with a moderate arch support and insole, fairly comfortable and can wear all day for outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Deane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Runs small for women get a aler size.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well made and will be great for my daughter s jpb at the zoo and amimal rehah centers.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Best waterproof wetland boots I’ve ever worn! Perfect for the variety of rough terrain we cover.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a variety of wetland, riparian, and forested areas. We cover a lot of uneven ground, wade through creeks and streams, cross sand bars, mud flats, and flood pools, and encounter fallen logs, briers, heavy brush, sharp beaver-gnawed saplings. Been doing that for almost 20 years and these are the best boots I’ve ever had— tried many brands over the years. My field research team says the same thing and now I only buy this brand and model for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tamplin

customer_reviews.title: Decent boots. Maybe too warm for anything over freezing temps
customer_reviews.text: Would be perfect if they had 1/2 sizes available. My foot pulls up a bit when going up hills because of the lack of ankle support and not the quietest but seem good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: The Original MuckBoots Adult Wetland Boot
customer_reviews.text: The boots were a bit large but just right with a thick pair of knee socks. I expected them to be heavy and hot but they are not too heavy and not hot even with the thick socks. The sole has great traction, did not slip or slide even on hilly ,wet terrain. I had difficulty removing them the first time ( I didn"t read the instructions) but the tab on the back of the boot makes it easy. I love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Florence Lansden

customer_reviews.title: order a larger size
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 EEE so I ordered a 10, fit is good / wish they had wide sizes but I think they will work out OK Ordered also the heavy duty boot puller, really helps get them off
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Breland

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again...
customer_reviews.text: I poked a hole in one boot the first time out in the field. They puncture very easily. I contacted the manufacturer and they suggested some aquaseal to repair the hole. I haven't found that yet but will try it. After that I'll wait for the next time they suddenly leak and then I'll throw them away. These are not the quality I expected for the price!
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn Muck boots at work nearly every day for 3 years. First 2 pairs were Edgewater, last 1 Chore. I wanted a warmer boot this year so I opted for the Wetland. It’s perfect for my winter boot. I wear a support orthotic all my rubber boots.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Hubby is a happy hunter
customer_reviews.text: My husband swears by these boots! They keep his feet warm and dry for frigid temperatures hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: I really like the way these look just wish they were more narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot is there anything that I could do to fill the void? Cause doubled up socks isn’t working. The length is right just to wide
customer_reviews.author: Lance McCoy

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent boots. Ive been wearing them for years
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent boots. Ive been wearing them for years. For hunting, trapping, fishing, and scouting. I put alot of miles on these boots daily through rough weather in Pennsylvania winters. I walk 6 to 10 miles a day on average for my trapline. I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a boot to be durable and they will keep your feet warm and dry. For cold days sitting in stands I would recommend woody max or arctic pro boots.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley270

customer_reviews.title: Git er done
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for mud, snow, dirt, slush, muddy snow, leaves, rocks, sand, wood planks, horse debris, pig debris, flooded basements, alpaca waste, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Zach S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesomd!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are wonderful. I got a pair from Bass Pro Shops and not long after I was ordering a pair for my boyfriend. They fit just snug enough around your calf that no moisture gets in and they are so well insulated. The sole is comfortable enough that I can walk in them for a long period of time and my feet don't get sore. I would definitely recommend these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Machinsky

customer_reviews.title: Husband wears 10.5, ordered 11 and perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: My husbands first pair of Mucks! I've loved them for years and decided it was time he get in on the goodness. He loves these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet dry and warm
customer_reviews.text: a little pricey but glad i bought them. As long as they last a long time the price will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Years Of Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. First pair is 5 years old and still going strong. I usually slip into them without socks to make a quick run outside in the snow/wet/mud. They are warm, completely dry and very comfortable. With or without socks, the stretch fabric allows for easy removal without using hands.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Koch

customer_reviews.title: Definite good buy. Good warmth. Good comfort. Good traction. Good waterproofing.
customer_reviews.text: This is the boot I've been looking for. Very warm without being clammy. Comfortable enough to stand around all day in, though I don't know if I'd go hiking in them. They got the ultimate test this weekend when I took my 3yr old sledding. I had to drag him in the sled up the hill a number of times, but the boots were great. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: High quality boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for my power washing business . I have worn them every day at work for one year . Very comfortable. Show no signs of wear. These are the best boots I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but too tight around the calf
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, these boots are well constructed and are very comfortable on the feet however they grip the calf and it becomes very uncomfortable after an hour or so of wear. I am a thin woman, 5'5 so I didn't think I would have a problem but I had to return. Ordering a larger size wouldn't work as they fit very true to size in the foot. If you have thin calves, I think these rainboots would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: G Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great. I wish I had bought them ten years ago. I usually wear shoes in a size 8. I bought. Size 8. They are working great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: A must for a ATV, love these, then had to buy the wife some.
customer_reviews.author: Celtick

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for my dad after his others had been split. He loves them and they are waterproof! His last pair lasted a few years and these are holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but runs large
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots but I wish I would have gotten a whole size smaller. I normally wear an 11 1/2 to 12 and got these in size 12. Regret not getting the size 11. I feel that even with an 11 these would still slip on and off easy. I normally just wear regular socks and even when I put on thick wool socks, I still had plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: m7

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, comfortable and have already walked several miles ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, comfortable and have already walked several miles checking my trail cameras and from a delivery point of view they arrived three days prior to the originally indicated date, thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Imhof

customer_reviews.title: Excellent winter boot
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair that I have purchased. They fit PERFECTLY and make your feel feel so good even after wearing them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Peony Peach

customer_reviews.title: Favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: I have used a pair of these for 1 full deer season and they have become my favorite boots. Great traction. Keep my feet surprisingly warm. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Warm Enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought them so I can launch/retrieve boat and hunt in mild to around freezing weather to replace some 400 gram Thinsulate boots that fell apart after 10 years. They should do the job and be OK when the temperature is above 25-30 Fahrenheit with one or two socks but I have other boots for when it is colder. They do seem to be quite comfortable when it is warmer (50-60 Fahrenheit) but I'm afraid they'll get ripped up if I walk through prickly brush.
customer_reviews.author: Peter in Kalamazoo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. They are good quality. Should last much longer than his rubber boots that get holes once a year. I decided to spend a little more and hope I won’t have to replace as often.
customer_reviews.author: SLKrouse

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: They are a gift. They have not been given yet.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOT !!
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about this boot, have several pairs of MUCKS, you can't go wrong buying a MUCK; we use them for deer hunting in wet & muddy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: This boot is good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, can't wait to try out during hunting season
customer_reviews.author: William B

customer_reviews.title: Was not happy
customer_reviews.text: Youse these boots at work do foundations in construction it's always wet after rain and mud my feet are always soaked at the end off the day no way your socks can be that wet from sweating maybe I got a bad pair but too dirty too send back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I need a size larger, not the boot, it’s my odd shaped feet. Good quality product
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hosker

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money! They do exactly as described, keep the water and moisture while keeping your feet warm. Superior quality, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tammy french

customer_reviews.title: I push these boots to the limits every year and they are the best knee boots on the market hands down
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple pairs of these boots; one for at home (Hunting, Fishing, Chores (snow shoveling, gardening), Etc) and one for work (Wildlife Biologist). I push these boots to the limits every year and they are the best knee boots on the market hands down. At work I will go through a pair of these boots every one to two years, but that is through very heavy daily use in the woods. I have tried other brands, but nothing holds up and provides the comfort day after day like Muck Boots. You will not be disappointed with these boots, and you cannot BEAT the price that Amazon offers!
customer_reviews.author: MN Smokey Bear

product_meta.title: Muck Wetland Rubber Premium Men's Field Boots
product_meta.description:
Muck Wetland Rubber Premium Men's Field Boots are ideal for outdoor work and for water fowlers who always get wet. With a comfort range of -20 °F/-30 °C to 50 °F/10 °C, these 100% waterproof boots perform well in all seasons. 5 mm neoprene provides exceptional comfort, flexibility, shock absorption and heat retention. The extended rubber overlays on these men's field boots protect your feet and ankles from outdoor hazards. For added comfort, they feature Airmesh linings that allow your feet to breathe, and EVA contoured, molded midsoles that follow the natural shape of your feet. The self-cleaning MS-1 ribbed outsole wraps around for optimal protection, stability and performance in mud and snow. Comfort toplines are designed to fit close and keep out debris, but can be rolled down in warmer weather.

A must-have for hunters, birdwatchers, or anyone whose works takes them outdoors, the Wetland Boot from MuckBoots is designed specifically for keeping feet dry and comfortable in the field. 100-percent waterproof from the toe to the top of the boot shaft, these unisex boots have durable, natural rubber uppers and a heavy duty, traction outer sole that can handle snow and mud. Superior comfort is achieved with a breathable, "Airmesh" lining, a CR flex-foam bootie, instep protector, and insulation that will keep your feet cool to over 70 degrees Fahrenheit and warm to sub-freezing temperatures.

The story began in 1999 with the sole purpose of building the most comfortable, high performance footwear on the market. The need for a more comfortable boot for use in messy and tough conditions led to the design of The Original Muck Boot Company brand footwear. Every boot in the line is expected to deliver the same 100% waterproof quality and comfort that inspired the original footwear. In just a few years, the line has grown to more than 20 styles, all designed to tackle tough conditions in agriculture, lawn and garden, outdoor sporting, equine, and pet care. Today, the Muck Boot brand defines a standard of comfort and quality that goes beyond the expectations of customers around the country.

See more
feature_bullets: 5 mm neoprene provides comfort and flexibility, along with excellent waterproofing, shock absorption and heat retention properties; adjusts to your foot shape to resist blisters and chafing

Stretch-fit Comfort Topline snugs calf to keep out cold and debris, but can be rolled down from high to mid for warmer weather; calf-high rubber overlay protects ankles from sticks, rocks etc. Shaft circumference is 17 inches
Lightweight EVA midsole for additional cushioning; self-cleaning MS-1 ribbed outsole wraps perimeter for maximum stability and performance in mud and snow
High-grade rubber provides extra toughness and makes for a 100% waterproof field boot; wrap-up toe bumper for extra toe protection
Breathable Airmesh lining wicks away humidity and perspiration, and allows air to travel throughout the boot while keeping water out; comfort rated from -20 °F to 50 °F (-30 °C to 10 °C)
